website_summaries.verdict: Not your average dog paw cleaner, this option features fine, brush-like bristles, ideal for fluffy paws.
pros: Soft, multi-layered bristles work to brush dirt out of fur and from between paw pads
Features an easy to grip handle
Available in multiple sizes and colors
cons: Can't be taken apart for cleaning

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a husky who thinks that if you don't ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a husky who thinks that if you don't get your paws muddy, then you wasted the day.
customer_reviews.author: Mooseica

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but product is defective
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our pup thinking it would be a great solution to muddy paws or excessive rock salt. Our puppy actually was quite patient and didn't mind using it. After about one month and perhaps 10 uses, the bristles are falling out in clumps. We haven't abused it or done anything unusual with it, so I'm extremely disappointed that this has been a waste of money. I wanted to contact the seller or ask for a refund because we were enjoying the plunger before it started falling apart, but apparently my window for contact or refunds has closed. Into the garbage it will go...
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work, very bulky.
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept, but this didn’t work. I live at an apartment, and there is a lot of crushed granite and dirt outside where my dog goes potty. I feel like since you have to stick the paw in and then pull it out, it just spreads the dirt around. I think something like this would work if you were brushing in one direction, but doing both is not good. It’s also really bulky to just keep on hand, and surprisingly heavy. I’ll stick with a towel by the door.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Wadsworth

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this product. The little black squeegee thing is very sharp and I feel bad putting my baby's paws through it. I tried putting my fingers through the squeegee to see if it was pliable and it scratched my hands up. Im not going to do that to my little one.
customer_reviews.author: T.J.

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous product, sorry I wasted money
customer_reviews.text: The interior plunger opening too small, stiff & sharp when pulling paw out. I cut it larger & my 8lb Shih Tzu still hates it. Save your time & wipe their paws with vinegar & water on soft cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Daily01

customer_reviews.title: Great for those dirty paws
customer_reviews.text: I used to keep a bucket of water by our back door to wash the dog's feet so husband bought this for me. I really like the product and it doesn't seem to make our dog uncomfortable. It took a while for dog to get used to the process and I don't think he likes getting his feet wet. I quite caring about that the first time it saved me from having to carry him to the bath to wash all the mud off. Instructions state to fill container with water up to top bristles. This is for optimum performance. We've used less water at times and have still had good results, slosh it around a bit if needed.
customer_reviews.author: N. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Solutions for Backyard Paws
customer_reviews.text: Ignore every person who says the bristles are "hard," I stuck my hand in the paw plunger and it is certainly not painful. Of course the bristles are sctracty, but they are meant to scrun and it's exactly what they do! My 60 lb dog tolerates it and he's pretty vocal about anything that bothers him. I just add 1/2 a tablespoon of vinegar and baking soda to the mug and fill with warm water for each use. This not only clean his paws, but it's a soothing mix for your dogs paws. Love the Paw Plunger!!
customer_reviews.author: latina

customer_reviews.title: Big enough for a Great Dane
customer_reviews.text: My Great Dane has been chewing on his nails to the point of bleeding. It's been really hard to get him to stop. It occurred to me that there's probably something in the grass that is irritating his feet and toes. Now, every time we come back into the house, I stick his feet in the plunger and then dry them off. After a few days of this, he's no longer chewing on his nails, and they've had time to heal. He's 175 Great Dane. I was concerned that the Plunger wouldn't be big enough for his feet, but it's really easy, and he likes it. It's a little foot massage for those big feet.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Bode

customer_reviews.title: Helps keep the house cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: I could not wait for it to rain to try out the Paw Plunger. It worked great! I have a mini Aussie at 30lbs and a standard Aussie at 50lbs. I chose the medium size to fit both of them. I think I might have been able to use the next size down. The only reason is that I am older and the medium filed with water is a little heavy for me to carry. The Paw Plunger does help with the dirt tracked in and cuts down on the time the dogs need to stay in the laundry room to dry before getting the run of the house.
customer_reviews.author: J Burns

customer_reviews.title: No more muddy paws...
customer_reviews.text: Product is great. I reached out to company regarding a concern regarding the cost. But never got a response. Would have rated this 5 stars had they responded. This works awesome. Have 2 1/2 year old Black Lab 70lbs..The medium size is perfect. No longer have muddy towels each time he comes in from the yard. Now, just have wet towels and the dog paws are much cleaner. Give this product a try, but look at Chewy.com and can probably get it for half the price i paid.
customer_reviews.author: T Smith

customer_reviews.title: Helpful Product and Happy To Have It
customer_reviews.text: I read a few reviews of people saying they had difficulty using this by themselves. I have 4 dogs and I'm a dog trainer, I personally don't find it difficult to use at all. I've been desensitizing all of my dogs to having their feet touched since the day I got them so using this has never been an issue. I'm very pleased with it and I'm glad I made the purchase. I can see how a dog that doesn't like its feet touched would be an issue, but that has nothing to do with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Not what you would expect.☹️👎
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered two. I followed the recommendation of other reviewers, it really does not work for my maltipoo and neither for my daughter's minitature Schnauzer. It has been a waste of money. Their paws get stuck in the inner brush. ☹️
customer_reviews.author: srn0107

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for dog owners
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these now. Our dogs don't mind standing while we "plunge" their paws. Never had trouble with the inner lip 'hurting" the foot. We did drill out a hole in the bottom of one of the plungers and plug it with a cork while cleaning. This has made draining the plunger quite efficient, otherwise I end up shaking the plunger upside down several times to empty out most of the wash water. The plunger doesn't sit flat anymore but to us that doesn't matter...but we probably won't make a hole in the second one. This is a good tool.
customer_reviews.author: Eliza S

customer_reviews.title: A life saver!
customer_reviews.text: I had never seen or heard of a Paw Plunger before I saw that a friend had one. Oh my goodness, this is a live saver! I was sooo tired of trying to keep my floors clean with dogs running in and out from the backyard! One of my dogs is completely easy, the other wants to eat the Paw Plunger but..we are learning! Order it! You won't believe how easy it is!
customer_reviews.author: Billie

customer_reviews.title: No thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Good concept, bad execution. The size of the of the dog should be an indication of the size mug to buy, not the weight of the dog. My dog weighs 20 lbs with short legs. No way would they fit in the medium size mug. The flappers on the lid are made of hard rubber with sharp points on the end. It only flexes inward when you put the foot in ( in my case, I put my hand in). When you remove it, the points are sharp and poke into the skin. The brushes do not rotate, so there is no scrubbing motion. I can do better with a bowl of warm water and a soft brush!
customer_reviews.author: tendy

customer_reviews.title: Thankful for this bucket of bristles!
customer_reviews.text: GET👏🏻THIS👏🏻PRODUCT👏🏻 We’ve seen a lot of rainy weather recently which means every time I let my dog out, he comes back to me knee deep in mud. The solution has always been to leave a beach towel outside to wipe him off before coming inside.. but no more! My husband ordered this and at first I laughed because I thought “$30+ for a bucket of water?!” But boy was I wrong. This thing is awesome. The bristles gently wipe off dirt, rocks, & grass. After just a few dips, his paws are sparkling again. My dog is stays calm during the entire process and it’s created a more manageably clean house. Thankful for this paw dipper!
customer_reviews.author: Madeline’s Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: This is AWESOME! We have a 65 lb labradoodle and bought a medium. Her paws fit well through the hole. The inside is soft enough to not hurt her. We used to always wipe her paws when she came in but this makes me realize how much we were missing when the water comes out brown after a quick dunk. We used positive reinforcement and treats the first few times and she doesn't mind getting them cleaned now. I'd definitely purchase this again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for any dog!
customer_reviews.text: I got a medium based on the other reviews. I have an 80lb goldendoodle and she has black fur so dirt isn't always the most apparent, but the water is always SO gross and dark when I wash her paws with this. The bristles are gentle and the diameter could be a bit smaller but the depth is good. I'm taking off one star because it can be a bit clunky and heavy to move around, but its not bad. I use it ever 2-3 days since we go to the dog park nearly everyday. I was dreading springtime mud and rain but with this, I'm totally set.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Cleans off her paws in just seconds!
customer_reviews.text: We had gotten this since my big clumsy golden doodle, Nala, keeps getting into mud and dirt, and it’s hard to clean her. Ever since we got this, it has been really easy to just dunk her paws and watch them get clean! Now we use this after every walk. Would recommend this over wiping with a rag! 🐾 🐕
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Cannot live without it.
customer_reviews.text: Get an Australian Shepard puppy with WHITE paws they said. Let him run through the mud and snow in Upsate NY they said. It will be fun they said! Buy this. You will not be sorry. Best $20 we have ever spent. Dunk your pups paws in a few times and wah-la! Clean paws. Hint. Use warm water only. You don't need soap. I hope whoever invented this product got filthy stinking rich.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Mandatory for Goldens or Labs.
customer_reviews.text: We have a golden retriever, which has to be the dirtiest breed when it comes to paws. They’re big, furry feet on a dog that loves muck. We had a previous Golden and owned a paw plunger that worked well (but i gave away). Our new golden is equally dirty, and i tried to cheap out and buy lesser versions of a law cleaner that didn’t work nearly as well. Bottom line - if you own a lab or a golden, this is a mandatory purchase.
customer_reviews.author: greg wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Handle is clutch!
customer_reviews.text: I love the paw plunger! I bought the medium size because I have a bigger 50 lb dog and a small 15 lb dog and was hoping I wouldn't have to buy 2. Perfect size for big dog and just a tad too tall for my little one, but he is so great with it that it doesn't matter. My big dog got spooked the second time. So I am working on it with treats to make him feel comfortable. Bristles are super soft. Super easy to clean! I got this one because of the handle. Makes it easy to control their paws and hold it. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: To heavy and hard to hold
customer_reviews.text: Large size is to heavy once you add water. Poor design on the handle. Your leaning over to hold it to wash your dogs feet. While you're holding it you have to twist your wrist to hold it upward or spill it. It the handle was the opposite direction it would work.
customer_reviews.author: Hey

customer_reviews.title: so great
customer_reviews.text: Honestly so happy I bought this. My husband would get frustrated trying to clean the dogs paws off when the yard gets muddy and I would end up cleaning mud off of our furniture. This is so much easier and even our finicky dogs allow us to use it with virtually no struggle. Easy to empty and refill, feels sturdy. A couple tips, keep a towel around to dry their paws off and if they have longer nails it won't get all of the mud out from under them. But otherwise I'm extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica A Suggs

customer_reviews.title: Not feasible for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally bought the tiniest size, not noticing this came in different sizes. But even my small-medium size dogs are too short for this to work. Even if their paws fit, I would literally have to pick them up and dunk their paws in (which wouldn’t work because the bristles cause resistance otherwise this wouldn’t clean). If you have a bigger dog that doesn’t mind its paws being touched, this probably works. But for very short dogs, just get a good dog mat.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Good idea....just too heavy
customer_reviews.text: I have three big dogs and a muddy yard. I thought this would help, but when it is filled with water and soap it is just too heavy to plunge onto their feet, and they won't do it themselves. LOL. It's too big and unwieldy. Also, when we are able to use it the water gets too dirty too quickly.....definitely not able to do more than one dog at a time. Just too much of a hassle to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.text: This has worked so well for our dogs who have been on a digging spree lately. We got a medium for our 50lb pit mix and 25lb beagle, and we probably could have even gone down a size. The bristles go all the way around the inside, and the bristles and plastic around the hole are soft. The only down side is that I have to keep a towel nearby to dry them off afterwards unless I want wet paw prints all over my floors.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: The answer for our dog’s muddy paws...
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had only a taste of the rainy season ahead, but we got the paw plunger so as not to have the problems we had last year. Our soil is rich with iron - bright orange clay - and the dogs bring this in and leave tracks all over the floors and carpets. Not so with the paw plunger - between it and the gorilla rugs, we’re paw print free so far! The dogs don’t mind the paw plunger because they get a treat afterward.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara McArthur

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my floors clean!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! I have a rescue dog that does not like her paws cleaned/dried off. She actually does not mind putting her paw in it though! She is outside all the time, and our backyard is nothing but mud right now because my husband plugged/reseeded the whole yard. Now we have lots of rain from the hurricane. This really cleans her paw without much work. I do empty/clean it every morning, and you would not believe the amount of red dirt in the bottom!
customer_reviews.author: JENNIFER RILEY

customer_reviews.title: great for cleaning dirty paws
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use when our dog has been playing at a muddy dog park, and the grooming wipes are not enough to clean him. It’s very easy to use - simply put water into it, and plunge his paws one at a time (up and down, up and down). Then, repeat until clean. I think it works pretty well in getting his paws clean. He doesn’t seem irritated by it, either, because the fibers in it are not that rough. We actually use this quite often. It’s much easier than putting him in the tub!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: A great product. And if you don't have the same problem with you dog's toenails getting dirty then this will work well for you!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, very sturdy. I couldn't get the dirt around my dog's toenails though. That was the biggest reason I bought it because after each walk I end up with a filthy washcloth from the dirt under and above their toenails. The pads get dirty and between the pads but around the nails, so much gets caught there. Anyhow, I just couldn't get at that area with it. So disappointed. But it is a great product. If you don't have the same problem with you dog's toenails then this will work well for you!
customer_reviews.author: MES

customer_reviews.title: Paw Plunger
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my two fur girls, under 20 pounds. My heavier girl has smaller paws...so it works. I just wish you could take it apart to clean it. You can remove the top lid, obviously...then you can remove the black plunger rim, too. But the brushes inside are permanent. The other one I ordered before had that feature...but was too big for my fur babies. And it’s pink!
customer_reviews.author: V C Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh....
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure if this was as effective as I anticipated that it would be. We have a 45 pound golden doodle, and I ordered a medium. He romps in our back garden while barking at the dogs who lice behind us and comes back to the house a muddy mess. My husband has some multi-hose contraption hooked up to the spigot, so I have a hard time figuring out which hose works, plus winter is coming. So, I hoped this was the answer. Maybe not. After two times of multi-dunkings for each foot, plus towel drying, the dog is still muddy enough to leave tracks everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: K1mom

customer_reviews.title: Way better than a bowl or bucket
customer_reviews.text: These work pretty well. It is not a miracle, but I think it does a pretty good job, and you can get a lot of cleaning without making as much of a mess with water splashing around. The only issue I had is that the threads are not well designed. However, the top stays on and it does the job. Depending on the situation and the dog's anatomy, you still may have to wipe up inside the paw. Like I said, it is not a miracle, but I like it and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Fish

customer_reviews.title: CLEAN PAWS
customer_reviews.text: This arrived just as I was bringing my muddied pawed dog in from outside. Works well. It is taking some getting used to for my 115 lb Rhodesian Ridgeback but it works. We keep a towel by the door so we can dry them after washing them off. It's kind of big and bulky but so are my dogs paws!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, hard plastic at the top, hurts pups ...
customer_reviews.text: This disappointed. It is made from a hard, sharp edged plastic at the top, hurts our pups paws. I had read conflicting reviews before I ordered, and still decided to give it a shot, but I wish I would have listened. Not worth 2 cents, in my opinion. The opening part has very sharp/hard edges, and causes discomfort to our dogs when trying to clean their paws. I am sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: R.C.Top Contributor: Health & Wellness

customer_reviews.title: This product works
customer_reviews.text: With all the rain and snow lately muddy paws tracking across our hardwood was a major problem. To make things worse our 6 month old pup has white paws. It took a couple of times before he would let me use the plunger on his feet. I finally put him on a wicker chair, minus the cushion, on the porch, gave him a treat and he cooperated very well. I use a little bit of shampoo and can clean all four paws fairly quickly. I sometimes refill the plunger with clean water if they are really dirty. This has been a lifesaver since he goes out 5 times a day. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: K. Summers

customer_reviews.title: It works but they're a little big
customer_reviews.text: Dog doesn't really care for it but it's easiest way I found a clean paws off from a muddy yard. These are a little big and hard to maneuver though. I didn't get the big one either. Best to just set it on the ground and take the dog paw to it.
customer_reviews.author: The Robertson family

customer_reviews.title: IMPRESSED.
customer_reviews.text: WOW. We talked about getting this for months and when spring came around we knew we had to. This has saved us (mostly our dog) from several baths. You just put the paw in and move up and down a few times, pull out and dry off. Our dog has a lot of fur so it takes the top of his paws awhile to dry off. I would HIGHLY recommend. I would also HIGHLY recommend you give your dog treats/rewards the first few times. Our dog hated doing this at first and was terrified but now he sits and takes it. :)
customer_reviews.author: CRef

customer_reviews.title: This is so great I own 2!
customer_reviews.text: The Paw Plunger is one of the best tools I own for keeping my dog’s paws and therefore my house clean. I have a standard golden doodle who loves to be outside in any kind of weather and this, cleans up her paws quickly without all the hassle. I bought a second plunger to use when her paws are extremely muddy and use one for the front paws and one for the back. Paw Plunger has been a life saving game changer at our house.
customer_reviews.author: Kzar

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, LOVE THIS❤️
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, LOVE THIS!!!! Has saved my floors everyday during the winter!!! Works well & my dog is used to the routine quickly.. The only drawback I have is, is that it's difficult to twist on.. We have resorted to just twisting it on 'the best we could @the time' otherwise you spend a lot of time trying to get it twisted on exactly right.. Besides that, it is VERY, VERY well made & will last for YEARS, I'm sure.. Very, very heavy duty plastic & would expect it to cost a lot more.. Very easy to clean, too, if you do it right away!! A great buy & I would recommend to anyone to buy👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Patrn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: This paw washer is perfect for small dogs. The height is small enough to use without picking the dog up. Some others advertised as for small dogs are too tall yo be usable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Have a dog?  Flooring?  Buy this immediately
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been my whole life? I will tell you this... The carpets in my old house would have lasted A LOT longer had I owned a paw plunger. After a rain, it's amazing the dirt that comes off my dog's paws with the plunger. It's almost morbidly fascinating to think that all of that mud, mulch, and debris would have gone straight into my floors. A tip - don't bother drying the paw with a towel after you plunge, just squeeze the excess water out and back into the plunger. Do not hesitate, just buy this thing.
customer_reviews.author: BJA

customer_reviews.title: I totally recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: My rescue is reluctant to try new things but usually adjusts if I can coax her through first 1-2 experiences. Read Amazon customer reviews which are always very helpful but still wasn't quite sure how to use the paw plunger and was concerned about the brushes since she has very short hair (Boxer mix). YouTube gave me the added visual I needed. My baby favorably responded on the first try. I almost fainted when I saw the amount of dirt removed! I totally recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: The ninja warrior of Paw Cleaning!!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don’t like about this product is the fact that I didn’t invent it! I had the idea and I never moved forward. So, let’s just say it’s a multi million dollar invention it’s perfect it does the job exactly like it’s supposed to! There’s just no reason for every dog owner not own one. Definitely my favorite part cleaning products on the market!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Handle cleans well
customer_reviews.text: This paw cleaner is perfect for our medium size doodle. I love the way it has the inner cannula of brushes to clean and twist out easily for rinsing. The handle makes it easy to handle and move around while hold our dog close by. The lid makes it easy to keep water filled and ready to go by the back door.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy M Hart

customer_reviews.title: This thing is fantastic. I recently had my back patio demolished
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic. I recently had my back patio demolished, so my back yard is one giant dirt pit, which becomes one giant mud pit when it rains. I have a 100+ lb German Shepherd with huge paws which have been COMPLETELY caked in mud when he comes back inside. The paw plunger is fantastic. Sometimes if the mud is really terrible it takes two cycles of paw plunging, but it works so well to get all of the dirt and mud out of his paws and out from in between his toes. This thing is seriously saving me!!
customer_reviews.author: LHinton

customer_reviews.title: Mud B Gone🐾🐾❣
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when I ordered this but I was tired of having a bucket and towel at the door only to eventually to be spilled. This came on a traditionally muddy day and I tried it. Dexter loves having his paws plunged into the warm water and the soft bristles must feel good to him because he sits patiently for the front paws and turns and waits for the back paws. No more spilled water on the floor! A clean towel is a must to dry. I just wish the top unscrewed to empty. Dexter is a Weimaraner and I ordered the medium. It fits his paws perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: L.Upton

customer_reviews.title: Grab a partner and start awkwardly cleaning your dogs paws with this!
customer_reviews.text: It does a decent job of semi-cleaning their paws. Its a bit of a pain to shove their paws in it and their pretty confused as to what's going on so that doesn't make it easier. You have to move their paws up and down in it in order for "scrubbing" skewers to do their job of cleaning their paws. Also, do NOT let it tip over or all the water will spew out. Its a two person job for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Matt & ElaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Product works
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I can't really complain about this item. It works just like it says it will. I just don't use it. I found it messy and a little too time consuming having to get down on my knees to plunge my 80 lb dog's paws in it. With that said, my dog didn't seem to mind his paws were definitely cleaner when we were finished. So the product works just as described ,it just wasn't for me.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Harter

customer_reviews.title: It's a good-enough solution to a tough problem
customer_reviews.text: We have a light-colored goldendoodle in rural Vermont (what were we thinking?) She comes in with muddy paws often, and just toweling off doesn't do enough to remove the dirt. It takes a bit of effort (she doesn't like it much) but this device makes it possible to wet and brush the dirt off without a full bath.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Clark

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp plastic under black latex lid
customer_reviews.text: After reading another reviewers comment of a sharp plastic ridge I checked mine out prior to using. Much to my surprise there was a very sharp ridge just under the black latex top on that blue surface in my photo. It only took a few swipes with fine grit sandpaper to correct. I would be giving 5 stars if not for the sharp edges and the ease of correcting it.
customer_reviews.author: Thom

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about how well this would work with my 65lb pitbull. Every time she went in the back yard after a good rain I would have to manually wash her paws in the bath tub prior to letting her roam the indoors. Now this product saves me a ton of time and works very well. I make sure to fill it with warm water prior to use. Warm water seems to help better with central Oklahoma clay mud.
customer_reviews.author: jdf

customer_reviews.title: No more stinky feet!
customer_reviews.text: My dog suffers from "frito feet", meaning she has bacteria build up in her paws and they start to smell like corn chips. I use this with a drop of anti bacterial soap 2 x a week and no more stinky feet! Luckily my dogs don't get too dirty or dig much but I always tell people about this product if their dog does!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Can not imagine NOT having this! Lifesaver for sure!!!
customer_reviews.text: Went from Yorkies all my life to rescuing an Old English Sheepdog (1.5 yrs old) that does not stop running in the yard, always finding the puddles, mud and biggest mess. Or making one. The product is easy to use (and he has zero training) and it really truly works as described.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Hippie

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, easy to clean and I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: Had looked at several different paw cleaning devices - the Paw Plunger won and I am glad I made this selection. Cooper is an Australian Labradoodle and loves to play outside every chance he gets. It has been an extremely wet, muddy winter for us and the Paw Plunger is certainly making it easier to clean his paws and he tolerates it well. When the cup is full, it is a little heavy, but still Quite helpful with getting those paws clean! I actually ordered 2 - wash his front paws in one and the back paws in the other. I like that it has a lid, although my husband says he doesn't think a lid is necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2.5 years till top cracked - does a good job cleaning paws
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job on our 3 golden retrievers who enjoy chasing around in the mud (this year Chicago has had multiple mud seasons). Lasted a little more than 2 years before the screw part of the top cracked, so currently we use it even though it empties out the top and top side and is difficult to clean the device. Reordering because it works better than anything else we have found.
customer_reviews.author: Pia & Richard Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: We love this! We have 2 large breed dogs that track mud/dirt in. We live in a 4 season climate and this comes in so handy during rainy and snowy season (which is about 3/4 of the year here!).
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Such a great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great purchase! We brought this to our camper to wash our dogs feet when he comes in the camper since we have a lot of dirt and mud around the camper. This has been a life saver! A lot of people have asked us what it was and they agree it’s very cool! The dog doesn’t mind putting his paws in the cup to be washed. This is much better than just washing in a tub of water!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Water, water everywhere
customer_reviews.text: This product is just ok. Yes, it removes the mud from the paws but it definitely does not "squeegee " the water from the paw as it comes out of the container. I have to have a towel not only real handy but I need to squeeze all the water and there is tons if water, off the paws. I try to squeeze the water off of the foot over the container but that does not usually happen. What does happen is water, water everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Nichy

customer_reviews.title: Great product, poor construction
customer_reviews.text: Bristles inside are poorly attached and come loose with just a few uses. I lose a few bristles every time I use this, which means that in a year or so it’ll just be a giant empty mug.
customer_reviews.author: S.D.

customer_reviews.title: Skittish dog likes it!
customer_reviews.text: My 70 lb part-Rhodesian aridgeback is pretty skittish. He doesn’t pull away or fuss when I use this. He gets his paws packed with mud on wet days because he’s so good at washing his ‘hands’ after pottying. This easily gets them clean and then I give them a towel dry I’m very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Kansas City Mike

customer_reviews.title: Dogs weren't into it
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this would work! It splashed water on the floor while "plunging" and my dogs hated it. Hopefully it works for some dogs but mine were not into it so I was never able to use it long enough to fully clean a paw.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Don't be scared if it looks huge
customer_reviews.text: Impressed! I was sceptical (why is it so dang big?)...but it really worked. It snowed here but the ground isn't frozen so the backyard is a mucky mess. This cleaned the pup up in less than a minute! The handle is useful but maybe more thread on the screw top would make opening/closing quicker and easy. I am waiting for pup boots to arrive but maybe I don't need them?
customer_reviews.author: tch

customer_reviews.title: So easy and cleans mud/dirt so well
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this thing a year now and decided I needed to leave a review: It is amazing. Whenever it rains our yard gets muddy along the fence line which of course is one of our dogs’ favorite places to be (they always find dirt/mud). I just fill that baby up with some water and put their feet in it. It cleans them SO WELL. My dogs do not care and let me clean their paws so I figure it doesn’t bother them. My pit actually loves it. Really this thing is great and I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kathrina

customer_reviews.title: Can't stop talking about this product!
customer_reviews.text: I've never wrote a review on a product before but I had to take the time to write about the Paw Plunger. This product is amazing! Total worth the purchasing. My Brittney mix is not very obedient but I can still get his paws cleared in about 30 seconds with the Paw Plunger, dry with a towel and away he goes. This design allows you to tilt the cup without the water pouring out. Super easy to clean. I'm even thinking of purchasing a second one to keep in our camper. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lora Bedell

customer_reviews.title: No More Muddy Carpet!
customer_reviews.text: I use the plunger by moving it up & down instead of moving my dog's paw because it is easier on her and me. It is easier than getting her to stand in a bucket of water or use washcloths to get the mud off her paws. No mess in my house when the plunger is used. We love it and so does our German Shepherd.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but too much hassle
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this product, but I did not like this product at all. It's very wide and awkward to hold. Also, I agree with other reviewers that the top plastic hurts. I wanted to like this, but I found that the trouble of getting soapy water ready, rinsing, drying, etc. was just more hassle than it was worth. Now I just have a towel at the door and that works just as well, if not faster/better. Great idea, just not for me and my pup.
customer_reviews.author: Nicoleodeon

customer_reviews.title: Ngl this thing is dope
customer_reviews.text: I have a 75lb german shepherd and whenever it rained I always would have to close the dog door off and constantly mop the floor. I used to try a wet rag to clean my dogs paws but it never really worked well and I'd run through towels. With this thing I just stick her foot in it move the cup around take it out, dry it off and its clean! No mud no scrubbing and only 1 towel. She didnt like it at first but after i tried using warm water she doesnt mind anymore
customer_reviews.author: Triple c

customer_reviews.title: Does a Decent Job
customer_reviews.text: This thing works pretty well. The multitude of brushes gets most of the dirt off, but the bristles are so soft it doesn't really get between the paw pads and get stuff that's stuck there. I have really thick, clingy, clay-like soil where I live, so that doesn't help. It's tough to clean that stuff. It will roll into balls and maintain its shape its so horrible, and clings like shoes to feet and paws. Otherwise, the Paw Plunger is simple to use and convenient, just make sure you have a towel nearby to sop up the extra gunk.
customer_reviews.author: LillithTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The idea is good but the execution leaves much to be desired
customer_reviews.text: I can see the idea but the practicality of this thing is lacking. It's hard to use as it's fairly cumbersome, and the the rubber flange that goes around the paw and leg falls off constantly leaving you with a big splash risk. We went back to the standard hose spray off the paw method as it's easier and surprisingly, less splash prone. The idea is good but the execution leaves much to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: R. C.

customer_reviews.title: Best investment for cleaner house and dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Love this for my mastiffs muddy feet. I have 4 mastiffs and the mud dirt that I'd get inside from there feet was crazy. The towels would be filthy in a day. And had to be washed like 4 times to get clean. Now they clean in seconds. Fast easy and my dogs stand perfect and let me do it. Definitely glad I bought it. Especially cuz we potentially have rain for more then 6m outta the year. In British Columbia Canada. Highly recommended.. sorry for long review normally do not comment this long. But this product was worth the good review. Let's just hope it lasts. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! I take our boy out daily to play ball & this time of year, his feet are muddy! I love that I can use warm water to clean his feet-the hose is cold!! I just plunge each foot up & down-actually I hold his foot steady & move the device up & down. Wipe off with a towel & we’re ready to go back inside! I gave it only 4 stars in use because I have arthritis in my hands, other than that it’s great!
customer_reviews.author: Kristy L. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: I think my dog loves it. She points to it before we go inside to use it. Some days she’s not muddy but now she has to do it before going into the house. I think she likes the feeling of the bustles. It’s easy to clean and I think it’s too big for my dog but hey I’m still keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: YariRodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I use it even when I don't think his paws are that dirty and and the before and after is shocking (he ...
customer_reviews.text: I was really on the fence about purchasing this since it seems a bit pricey for a glorified bucket but it is totally worth it. I have a 75lb Aussie with very thick paws and the medium works well. I use it even when I don't think his paws are that dirty and and the before and after is shocking (he has white feet so the difference is noticeable). It cleans the paws in two or three plunges. If you allow your dog on furniture or have carpeted areas, this is "a must have".
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Quite honestly, I dont think this product is for me. I have a lab. And when we lived in a muddy back yard he would track things in. I couldn't really get the lid to screw back on the threads right, the jug is large. I had an opened kid glass that seemed to to the trick just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Fabiani

customer_reviews.title: The bristles inside are gentle and fine. But the top really hurts
customer_reviews.text: The top rubber part is hard and somewhat sharp and hurts the paw of short haired dogs when they withdraw their paw. The bristles inside are gentle and fine. But the top really hurts. Just try it on your own hand! I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: PortiaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Too Heavy, Doesn't Remove Clay
customer_reviews.text: We have big dogs, so I bought the big washer. When filled with water, it's too heavy to hold. I only fill it about 1/3 full, still to heavy. Our soils have caliche clay and this washer doesn't remove it from the dog paws. Still cleaning the paws the old fashion way with a pail of water, soft brush and rags.
customer_reviews.author: SVB

customer_reviews.title: i don't use it
customer_reviews.text: eh i though this would be better. i don't feel that it really gets all the dirt off. it has a whole in the bottom that leaks water everything which is really annoying i fill it up in my kitchen sink and then have to cover the bottom with something so it doesn't get water everywhere and then when outside it makes a mess with water then my dogs stop in that water and their paw get all gross again. better use of your money is to buy a budget and a dog brush and drip dogs paws in the bucket and then scrub with a brush.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cleans paws quickly and efficiently
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a Border Collie mix, thus has long hair on her feet and on the inside of her paws. Naturally, when walking on rainy days, she collects lots of sand and pebbles that get lodged in her paws. I used to clean her feet with a bowl of warm water and a towel - water would often spill and the towel would get dirty quite quickly. The paw plunger solved all this - I pour in hot water before we depart - when we return the water are nice and warm. A few dips of each paw, a quick dry up with the towel and everybody's happy (especially the cleaning robot).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Good idea but I can use a cup of water and bath towels to clean them better than use this paw plunger.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Schulte

customer_reviews.title: A must have for dirty paws!!!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING!!!! Where has this been the last 13 years of my life??? I didn't have high hopes. I thought it was another gimmick. This thing cleans every last particle off my labs feet in seconds. Then all I do is dry with my squeegee towel and done! Not one trace of mud on my floors. Thank you!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Works great!  Happy we purchased!
customer_reviews.text: This really works! No soap needed. Just pushed my pup’s paws up and down a couple of times and voila! Clean puppy! I just wish I could remove the top and open it up to give it a good cleaning. It’s a sealed unit as designed today.
customer_reviews.author: D. Evans

customer_reviews.title: It's awesome! Finally got to use it, my dog doesn't mind it at all and does a great job.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this product, I haven't had a chance or reason to use it yet, looking forward to rain so my dogs paws get muddy so I can use it. Just wanted to let everyone know that the bristles are soft and I stuck my hand in there to see how it would feel and it seems fine, did not scratch or cut at all. I read a review that someone had posted saying the bristles cut their finger...that's not true at all. I'm looking forward to using this product. Will update my review once I actually use it.
customer_reviews.author: lucialibre

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We get a lot of rain in the PNW and my doggie always comes in the house with muddy paws. tis is saving our carpets.
customer_reviews.author: J. MARROTT

customer_reviews.title: After 100,000 miles, it finally gave in
customer_reviews.text: Morning exercise means the grass is wet. My dogs paws get destroyed. This helps me clean her paw and spend less time drying them. Ten months in and still good. Sadly, yesterday the rubber around the edge ripped but I had been using it consistently twice daily for the last 10 months!
customer_reviews.author: Osvaldo

customer_reviews.title: such a great idea and it works!
customer_reviews.text: rainy days isn’t such a chore with this. it’s easy to pop open and clean out and pop back on. brushes do a great job and i haven’t had to buy a new one yet. pup does not mind the paw wash although he was apprehensive at first
customer_reviews.author: anne march

customer_reviews.title: Great Invention
customer_reviews.text: What a great product for cleaning mud from my dogs paws. Heard about the paw plunger at work immediately bought one. No I don’t have spend 10-15 minutes wiping and cleaning. Just a copy plunges and there cleaning. Border collie retriever mix
customer_reviews.author: Mrcrash

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver on a rainy day when the backyard gets muddy.
customer_reviews.text: With constant rain for the past week and a new adopted Siberian husky puppy, this has been a lifesaver! Even though our new pup is an inside dog we always use this after she has been playing in our fenced backyard on potty breaks. Just make sure that the water is at room temperature or a little bit warmer than tapwater. This is a great invention and I plan to purchase more for friends who have dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Linda H.

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long?
customer_reviews.text: The pictures for the product are accurate. I had put off using it because I didn't want to have to dry wet paws. After using it, and after struggling to get my dogs' paws clean with just a towel, I will always use this first. Their paws dont come out soaking wet either. I will absolutely bring this over to my parents' house where we must wipe their paws every time they come in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the results!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really very happy with this product. I rent a house that has a backyard of dirt...so when it rains, yep all mud! I have two lab/pit mixes, and when it rained, I would need at least 5 towels at the door because after one wipe, completely covered in mud. When I use the Paw Plunger, I have one towel that I wipe the wet paws with, and that's it. My dogs were already used to having their feet wiped every time they came in, so using the Paw Plunger wasn't a problem. I'm really happy that there is something that can help my muddy paw situation! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Quit looking at other products and just buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying I have never written a review before because I’ve simply never felt the need to or cater to. But I was against these “Paw Cleaners” for so long and thought there’s no way they would work....I hated cleaning our labs paws every time it was wet/muddy out. But let me just say....WOW....this cleans our labs paws so quick and easy that I wish I would have gotten this years ago!!! You can read over this review in disbelief if you want and won’t bother me cause believe it or not, I could care less. Great product and seems very durable!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Best invention since sliced bread!
customer_reviews.text: This really works! My pup loves running around and digging and we've had an extremely wet season. This is great to clean her up quickly with no fuss. We keep it by the door and it has absolutely saved my floors and rugs!
customer_reviews.author: RachelTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This product does a pretty good job. I think it is going to be best used for when we travel to the park and don’t want the dirty paws on the seat cover. At home, it’s easier to pick the dog up, put her in the sink, rinse her feet, towel dry, and clean the sink. The process of using this, and then cleaning and drying the product takes so much more time. That’s why it will be better used on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous invention!
customer_reviews.text: This paw plunger really does the trick. There's nothing worse than having to try to use a towel to clean off muddy paws. This thing is awesome. It cleans Charlie's paws with no effort. All you do is put in water, dunk the paw in the plunger and it comes out clean. Just dry with a towel. It is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Muddy paws are CLEAN!
customer_reviews.text: Keep it by the back door for when my muddy boxer comes inside, easy to use even with a squirmy pup, just make sure you have a towel handy because you still have to dry the paws after- takes me about 1 minute to go from muddy to clean, saving my hardwoods from being so messy
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: Great product to help keep those paws clean
customer_reviews.text: We live in England, so it’s always raining and muddy. This helps eliminate the rag use in our house as we only have to dry them now . The only downside is you can open the bottom to really remove the dirty water . So I have to rinse a couple of times . Super gentle on their paws as well
customer_reviews.author: Erika A.

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job cleaning paws
customer_reviews.text: I liked that this device really cleaned my dogs paws! Only thing I didn't like is that there is always some water left on the bottom that will not dump out. Also the covering is cardboard which gets soggy when wet
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: silliest invention and it works great. You fill it with warm water, plunge (and chase down) the dog's paws into it two or three times and dry off (wrestle them to stay still) with a dry towel and off they go into the house. NO more muddy footprints! works nicely to get the snow and ice off too. hairy paws are the worst.
customer_reviews.author: I wear MOM Jeans

customer_reviews.title: Hate muddy feet? Problem solved!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I have an 80 pound pit bull that can be very particular about having his feet touched. He has no issue with sticking his foot in this! It is easy to clean and takes off so much dirt. I did order the medium size hoping that it would also work for my wiener dogs, but their legs are just too short! It’s the perfect size for my pit bull though! Such an awesome product and I’m happy to have found it!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Spencer

product_meta.title: Paw Plunger – The Muddy Paw Cleaner for Dogs – Saves Carpet, Furniture, Bedding and Cars from Dirty Paw Prints – Use This Dog Paw Cleaner After Walks – Soft Bristles, Convenient Cup Handle
feature_bullets: DOG FOOT WASHER – the Paw Plunger removes mud, dirt, salt, sand and more from your pet’s paws and lower legs after walks and outside play. Keep dirty paws out of your home and off your floors, carpet, furniture and car with this paw cleaner for dogs

THE EVERYDAY MUDDY PAWS CLEANER – this portable pet paw cleaner is designed with you and your fur baby in mind. The plunger cleans your dog’s paws quickly, reducing indoor mess and floor stains, and preventing paw irritation from contaminates

HOW TO USE – perfect for a quick paw wash. Add warm water to the top row of bristles and insert a dirty paw, gently moving it in and out of the plunger while the bristles wash away the dirt. Use a towel to dry each soggy foot and pour away dirty water

LET THE PAW CLEANER DO THE WORK – the ultimate in dog gadgets with soft bristles to easily remove dirt from paws, nails and lower legs in seconds. The convenient handle and wide no-spill opening assists fast and effective cleaning paw plunger for dogs

PAW PLUNGER MEDIUM – petware designed paw cleaner for medium dogs weighing 15-75 pounds. The cup measures approximately 8.55 L x 6 W x 6.5 H inches, Opening: 3.5 inches. Measure your pet before purchase. It's the ideal portable pet paw cleaner

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
